fields.descriptive_line: Costume for an Adolescent in Fokine's ballet Scheherazade, Daighilev Ballet, 1910.
fields.physical_description:
Costume for 'An Adolescent' in the Ballets Russes Production of Schéhérazade. Designed by Leon Bakst in circa 1910.

The costume includes a short jacket and harem style trousers. The collarless jacket is made from bistre yellow satin with tightly fitting sleeves which flare out at the cuffs to reveal the deep crimson undersleeves beneath. It fastens at the front where a false, triangular, panel of vivid pink silk has been added to create the impression of a pink bodice or undershirt. Hand painting has been used on the surface of the jacket to create the impression of a wide, petal shaped, collar outlined in deep blue and to add stylised tulips and foliage in deep pink, blue and green across the front, back and sleeves. 

The trousers or pantaloons are made from deep crimson cotton and are gathered into cascading 'layers' at the at thigh, knee and calf. Gold spangles have been sewn across the surface of each horizontal 'layer'.
[Theatre costume] Short jacket in bright bistre yellow sateen painted with stylized tulips and foliage in faded red and green, and deep pink infill in the neck.
[Theatre costume] Crimson cotton pantaloons, bound at thigh, knee and calf with ultramarine bands or gold braid, painted with gold (faded) 'commas'.
fields.public_access_description:
Costume for 'An Adolescent' in the Ballets Russes Production of Schéhérazade. Designed by Leon Bakst in circa 1910.

The costume includes a short jacket and harem style trousers. The collarless jacket is made from bistre yellow satin with tightly fitting sleeves which flare out at the cuffs to reveal the deep crimson undersleeves beneath. It fastens at the front where a false, triangular, panel of vivid pink silk has been added to create the impression of a pink bodice or undershirt. Hand painting has been used on the surface of the jacket to create the impression of a wide, petal shaped, collar outlined in deep blue and to add stylised tulips and foliage in deep pink, blue and green across the front, back and sleeves. 

The trousers or pantaloons are made from deep crimson cotton and are gathered into cascading 'layers' at the at thigh, knee and calf. Gold spangles have been sewn across the surface of each horizontal 'layer'. 

Schéhérazade was a ballet in one act, first performed by the Ballets Russes on the 4th of June 1910 at the Théâte National de l'Opéra, Paris. The first London performance took place on the 20th of July 1911 at the Royal Opera House. The ballet was choreographed by Michel Fokine to music by Rimsky-Korsakov. Leon Bakst produced designs for both the scenery and the costumes.
